background: A shampoo requires both sulfate and ginger as ingredients, with individual effectiveness times and quantity constraints. The goal is to minimize the total effectiveness time required for the mixture.
constraints: Units of sulfate must be at least MinSulfate
Total units of sulfate and ginger must equal TotalUnits
Sulfate-to-ginger ratio must be at most MaxSulfateGingerRatio
objective: Minimize the total time for the shampoo mixture to be effective
description: Both sulfate and ginger need to be added to a shampoo. One unit of sulfate takes \param{SulfateTime} minutes to be effective while one unit of ginger takes \param{GingerTime} minutes to be effective. The shampoo must contain at least \param{MinSulfate} units of sulfates and a total of \param{TotalUnits} units of both ingredients. Since too much sulfate can damage the hair, there can be at most \param{MaxSulfateGingerRatio} times the amount of sulfate as ginger in the shampoo. How many units of each should be added to the shampoo to minimize the total amount of time it takes for the mixture to be effective? (Note: one must be added before the other)

parameters.definition: Time for one unit of sulfate to be effective
Time for one unit of ginger to be effective
Maximum ratio of sulfate to ginger
